glossary.entry.healing.name: Healing
glossary.entry.healing.description: Healing points can be used to remove <style="wound">Wounds</style> on the Player or Followers
glossary.entry.movement.name: Movement
glossary.entry.movement.description: Movement points allow your character to Move around the map and Explore. The cost depends on the type of terrain. Movement will also trigger Enemies on the map when moving from a space adjacent to another adjacent space
glossary.entry.teleport.name: Teleport
glossary.entry.teleport.description: Teleport points allow your character to Teleport around the map one space at a time (1 point = 1 space). Teleporting does not trigger Enemies on the map
glossary.entry.influence.name: Leadership
glossary.entry.influence.description: Leadership points are used to activate certain Follower abilities; Buy more Cards, Interact and Recruit at map Locations
glossary.entry.interaction.name: Interaction
glossary.entry.interaction.description: Interacting with Locations happens when standing at the Location and using the Location's actions. Your Turn will ends after Interacting with locations or Battling with enemies
glossary.entry.turn.name: Turns
glossary.entry.turn.description: Each round has multiple Turns. Each Turn ends automatically when you interact with a Location or Battle with Enemies. Mana Essence is discarded and you will Draw cards back to Hand Size
glossary.entry.round.name: Rounds
glossary.entry.round.description: Each crusade has multiple Day or Night Rounds. Rounds end when you run out of Turns when your Deck is empty (Sleep) or if the Timer runs out. All Cards will be shuffled and you will Draw cards back to Hand Size. Followers and Blessings will be Refreshed
glossary.entry.sacrifice.name: Sacrifice
glossary.entry.sacrifice.description: Sacrificed Entities are Destroyed and removed from the game
glossary.entry.xp.name: Experience Points (XP)
glossary.entry.xp.description: XP is earned by defeating enemies or playing certain abilities.
glossary.entry.effect.name: Effects
glossary.entry.effect.description: Effects are generated by Cards, Blessings, Followers or Locations. Some effects require you to drag & drop from the pool to the target entity to activate them while others are applied passively
glossary.entry.terrain.movement.cost.des: Depending on Terrain you will need to pay a variable amount of Movement points to pass through it. Some terrains are Impassable (ex: mountains or lakes) without special Abilities.
To expand the map you go to the edges and pay Movement points to Explore a new section. The number of sections is limited and the Map will 'follow' you where you explore until you run out of sections
glossary.entry.terrain.exploration.dista: To explore you normally need to be adjacent to the Edges of the map (exploration distance of 1). Some Abilities allow you to explore by being futher away from the Edges of the Map
glossary.entry.block.name: Blocking
glossary.entry.block.description: Blocks are used during Battle in the Block phase. Use Abilities to generate Blocks then drag them on the Attack that you want to Block. Blocks are all or nothing so you need an amount of block equal or greater than the Enemy Attack Value (x2 if Enemy is Resistant to the Block type). Blocked attacks do not generate damage/wounds
glossary.entry.block.elemental.name: Elemental Blocks
glossary.entry.block.elemental.descripti: Some Enemies have Resistance to Physical or Elemental Attacks and Blocks. Using Elemental Blocks against enemies with Resistance to that element makes the Block <style="status">Inefficient</style> and requires <style="value">double</style> the amount of Block to be successful.
